node.title: WritableVariable access
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I'm using UserObjects to read from and write to AuxVariables. For writing purposes I use WritableVariables. The Problem I'm facing is following error
*** ERROR ***
'calc_sense' already obtained a writable reference to 'dV'. Only one object can obtain such a reference per variable and subdomain in a simulation.

The workflow of the simulation is:

Calculate the initial value of a scalar and an elemental AuxVariable in a UserObject and write them. The elemental AuxVariable uses a WritableVariable reference.
Read the value from the elemental AuxVariable in a second UserObject, do some modifications and write it back using a WritableVariable reference once again (which is where the error occurs).
Read both the scalar and the elemental AuxVariable again for the final computation.

Is there a way to get this working as it is? Or do I have to split my UserObject into an AuxScalarKernel and an elemental AuxKernel?

Hello
This check was added on purpose to avoid execution ordering issues.
The cleanest way forward here would be to turn one of your user objects into auxiliary kernels. These are the cannon way of setting auxiliary variables.
If you can't do that, I d just comment out the check in the framework and make sure things are still computed in the expected order
Guillaume

Ok thanks. I'll contemplate the switch to AuxKernels since that would also resolve the other issue I'm having  (#26806). I just thought it'd be neat to compute the scalar value and the matching elemental value in one object.
I'm controlling the execution order through setting the execution order group, so there shouldn't be any issues there.
For now I decided to just go with the "comment out" option so I don't have to refactor my code.

node.title: sensitivity analysis
node.bodyText: When I was training a polynomial chaotic proxy model using an old version of MOOSE, I used 120 CPUs to calculate one example, but in the end, only one CPU was allocated to this example for calculation
Please update your moose, managing the number of processors per app was added in 2021 to the stochastic tools module. Originally, the batch-reset/restore options used one process per app.
Is there any other way to set a single instance CPU on the old MOOSE? Does having too many polynomial chaotic trainers affect computational efficiency?
For example, modifying the batch-reset/restore  ?
Can we use code modification to make batch reset/restore options use multiple CPUs?

node.title: 'darcy_thermo_mech' tutorials not compiling, but 'examples' are compiling?
node.bodyText:
I'm working on a Linux laptop and following the MOOSE VIrtual Workshop (Summer 2020), and for some reason I cannot compile the darcy_thermo_mech/step01_diffusion file.
I have made sure that I am in the correct directory, which is /projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/step01_diffusion. I have also made sure that I have executed conda activate moose. However, when I execute the command make, I get the following error message/output:
Not compiling MOOSE with NEML2 because NEML2_DIR is not a valid NEML2 checkout and/or libtorch is not enabled.
Linking Library /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la...
libtool: warning: library '/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la' was moved.
libtool: warning: library '/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/heat_transfer/lib/libheat_transfer-opt.la' was moved.
/bin/grep: /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la: No such file or directory
/bin/sed: can't read /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la: No such file or directory
libtool:   error: '/home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la' is not a valid libtool archive
make: *** [/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/app.mk:370: /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la] Error 1

It is important to mention that after I installed MOOSE, I changed the 'projects' directory to 'projects_MOOSE' just as I thought this was a better name. But then as I realised a lot of the examples on the MOOSE website run with the directory titled 'projects', I changed the name back. But even still, I was able to compile the first three examples in projects/moose/examples after doing this and they all worked perfectly fine? So how can I get the tutorial examples to work/compile?
Note: I changed the 'projects' directory back to 'projects_MOOSE' and then tried to compile the step01_diffusion application again, and got a slightly different error message (see below). It seems like MOOSE doesn't like the fact that I've changed the 'projects' directory to 'projects_MOOSE' after installation?
Not compiling MOOSE with NEML2 because NEML2_DIR is not a valid NEML2 checkout and/or libtorch is not enabled.
Symlinking MOOSE configure /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/build/header_symlinks/MooseConfig.h
Linking Library /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la...
libtool: warning: library '/home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/tensor_mechanics/lib/libtensor_mechanics-opt.la' was moved.
/bin/grep: /home/enk001/projects/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/lib/libtensor_mechanics-opt.la: No such file or directory
/bin/sed: can't read /home/enk001/projects/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/lib/libtensor_mechanics-opt.la: No such file or directory
libtool:   error: '/home/enk001/projects/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/lib/libtensor_mechanics-opt.la' is not a valid libtool archive
make: *** [/home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/app.mk:370: /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la] Error 1

I was also curious: Do Peacock and Paraview come with the MOOSE installation? Or do I have to install them separately to view results generated in MOOSE?
Thanks in advance!

Hello
When did you download moose?
The tutorials were not building for a week last week, that got fixed
Guillaume

I downloaded MOOSE on Friday (two days ago)? Should I update conda and MOOSE and retry? Am I right in saying that it shouldn't matter that I changed the directory name from 'projects' to 'projects_MOOSE'?
If I update conda and MOOSE, do you know how much GB this will use? I am currently hotspotting my laptop's internet connection with my mobile phone, and I have a monthly limit of 100 GB so I don't want to chew into this too much?

Friday should have been fine.
I'll check the tutorials when I get back.
For now can you use the next branch instead of the master branch (use git checkout next)

Renaming the projects folder is totally ok
And a full moose and libmesh will be a couple GB if you started from fresh. For an update probably under a GB

Renaming the projects folder is totally ok
And a full moose and libmesh will be a couple GB if you started from fresh. For an update probably under a GB

I switched to the next branch using git checkout next, but ultimately I got a similar error message (see below) when trying to compile step01_diffusion:
Not compiling MOOSE with NEML2 because NEML2_DIR is not a valid NEML2 checkout and/or libtorch is not enabled.
Checking if header needs updating: /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/include/base/MooseRevision.h...
Symlinking MOOSE configure /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/build/header_symlinks/MooseConfig.h
Creating Unity /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/build/unity_src/userobjects_Unity.C
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/build/unity_src/userobjects_Unity.C...
Linking Library /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/libmoose-opt.la...
Linking Library /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la...
libtool: warning: library '/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la' was moved.
libtool: warning: library '/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/heat_transfer/lib/libheat_transfer-opt.la' was moved.
/bin/grep: /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la: No such file or directory
/bin/sed: can't read /home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la: No such file or directory
libtool:   error: '/home/enk001/projects_MOOSE/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/ray_tracing/lib/libray_tracing-opt.la' is not a valid libtool archive
make: *** [/home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//framework/app.mk:370: /home/enk001/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/../..//modules/module_loader/lib/libmodule_loader_with_ray_ht_tm_pf-opt.la] Error 1

Some of the warnings are detecting this moving around.
Did you build moose then change the project folder name?
If so you want to git clean -xfD the repo then build again (save all your work first with git commit -a)

Yes I built MOOSE using the following code:
mkdir -p ~/projects
cd ~/projects
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git
cd moose
git checkout master

Then I changed the directory 'projects' to 'projects_MOOSE'.
Did you 'make' before or after changing the projects folder?

So would I execute the following code? (see below):
git clean -xfD
git commit -a
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git
cd moose
git checkout master

I'm kind of new to git so learning this too.

I executed the code below immediately after installing MOOSE.
cd ~/projects/moose/test
make -j 6

I then changed the projects folder and then tried to 'make' with the tutorial step01_diffusion example and it failed. But I was able to 'make' the first three 'examples' even after changing the projects folder?

node.title: mixed usage of AD and non-AD materials and kernels
node.bodyText:
Dear all,
I add one finite element AD kernel and use it with other non-AD kenels in Porous Flow.
I need to use the AD and non-AD property 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' in these kernels. When I run my input, I get the following message:

The requested AD material property 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' of type 'std::vector'
is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'std::vector'.

It seems it is not allowed to use the AD and non-AD property 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' in one input file.
Is there a solution for this? Are the AD materials and kernels only used in finite volume parts of Porous flow modules in its current status?
Thanks.
B

Hello
There is a material to create the converted AD or non AD version of a property.
It s the MaterialADConvertor and it s counterpart for the other direction of conversion
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/MaterialADConverter.html
Guillaume

thanks for your tips.
I add the following contents in my input.
 [convert_to_AD]
   type = MaterialADConverter
 	reg_props_in = 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal'
 	ad_props_out = 'AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal'
 []

And I change
_fluid_density_node(getADMaterialProperty<std::vector>("PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal")),
into
_fluid_density_node(getADMaterialProperty<std::vector>("AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal")),
in my own AD kernel.
When I run my input, I get the following error:
***** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "PorousFlow_density_nodal_all", of type "PorousFlowJoiner".

The declared non-AD material property 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' of type 'std::vector<double>'
is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'double'.

I want to use MaterialProperty ("PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal") in non-AD Kernel and  ADMaterialProperty("AD PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal") in AD Kernel.
It seems that every property can only be one type of AD or non-AD, not both types in one input file.
Could you please help with this? Maybe adding a new AD material is an easier way?
Thanks again.
B

The error is complaining about a difference between a vector and a double (single floating point number) type
So this is not about AD conversion anymore
you need to re examine the types for the creation and consumption of the material properties. And make sure they match with your code.

I think that both the AD and non-AD material property have the same name, so this won't work? I'm guessing that you have both of these
[fluid]
  type = PorousFlowSingleComponentFluid
[]
[adfluid]
  type = ADPorousFlowSingleComponentFluid
[]

but they both make a material with the same name, and then the other objects don't know which to access?
Unfortunately, you might have to modify the code to do this. Perhaps we should add an ad_ to the front of the material property name when the ad version is used? @GiudGiud - do you think this is the way to go? It wouldn't be hard to do. I hadn't considered someone trying to use both AD and non-AD version of a material at the same time.

I dont think the prefix is necessary unless

you start doing this in normal operations
you do not let users specify the names they want for material properties.

The MaterialADConverter lets you use one of the two Materials and manually add the prefix there. Then in AD objects you specify the prefix
From the error message mentioning 'double' vs std::vector I dont think this is just AD vs non-AD anymore

Thanks for your tips @GiudGiud and @cpgr .


To avoid both the AD and non-AD material properties having the same name, I added a new property named 'for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' totally same to the 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' in Material: PorousFlowActionBase.C
_density(_compute_rho_mu
? (_nodal_material ? &this->template declareGenericProperty<Real, is_ad>(
"PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal" + _phase)
: &this->template declareGenericProperty<Real, is_ad>(
"PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_qp" + _phase))
: nullptr),
_for_AD_density(_compute_rho_mu
? (_nodal_material ? &this->template declareGenericProperty<Real, is_ad>(
"for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal" + _phase)
: &this->template declareGenericProperty<Real, is_ad>(
"for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_qp" + _phase))
: nullptr),


in Material: PorousFlowSingleComponentFluid.C
(*_density)[_qp] = _fp.rho_from_p_T(_porepressure[_qp][_phase_num] * _pressure_to_Pascals,
                                    _temperature[_qp] + _t_c2k);

(*_for_AD_density)[_qp] = _fp.rho_from_p_T(_porepressure[_qp][_phase_num] * _pressure_to_Pascals,
                                                                        _temperature[_qp] + _t_c2k);

in Action: PorousFlowAddMaterialJoiner.C
        if (params.get<bool>("compute_density_and_viscosity"))
        {
          if (at_nodes)
          {
            addJoiner(at_nodes,
                      is_ad,
                      "PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal",
                      "PorousFlow_density_nodal_all");
            addJoiner(at_nodes,
                       is_ad,
                      "for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal",
                      "for_AD_PorousFlow_density_nodal_all");

in Action: PorousFlowSinglePhaseBase.C
const bool compute_rho_mu_qp = _deps.dependsOn(_included_objects, "density_qp") ||
_deps.dependsOn(_included_objects, "for_AD_density_qp") ||
_deps.dependsOn(_included_objects, "viscosity_qp");
The above information is the main part of the newly added property named 'for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal', some similar codes are not shown here.


The new property 'for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' has the same type of 'std::vector' to 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal'   as shown in PorousFlowMassTimeDerivative.C
_fluid_density(_multiply_by_density ? &getMaterialProperty<std::vector>(
"PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal")
: nullptr),


I use the MaterialADConverter
[convert_to_AD]
type = MaterialADConverter
reg_props_in = 'for_AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal'
ad_props_out = 'AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal'
[]
to get the 'AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' required in my own AD kernel.
_ad_fluid_density_node(getADMaterialProperty<std::vector<Real>>("AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal")),

But I still get the following error information:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "PorousFlow_density_nodal_all", of type "PorousFlowJoiner".
The declared non-AD material property 'PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal' of type 'std::vector'
is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'double'.

you declare it as a Real
_density(_compute_rho_mu
? (_nodal_material ? &this->template declareGenericProperty<Real, is_ad>(
"PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal" + _phase)

and retrieve it as a vector
_ad_fluid_density_node(getADMaterialProperty<std::vector<Real>>("AD_PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal")),

that s the problem
Thanks a lot.  Yes, you are right! It solves.

node.title: Reading files on the go rather than pre-read everything before simulation starts
node.bodyText:
Hi guys,
I'm working on mining hydro simulation in transient, I need to update the damage (via PropertyReadFile > GenericConstantArray > PorousFlowPorosityConstCSV) file at every time step vai Controls, it appears that MOOSE read all the 50+ files at once at the beginning which take so much RAM. is there a way to make it read the data on the go?
or is there any other ways to work around this?
Thank you guys!
example of the input file below:

[./damage_read_EXCHG_0001_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = PropertyReadFile
prop_file_name = 'EXCHG_0001_LOGPCOMBINED.inp'
nprop = 1
 read_type = element
[../]
[./damage_read_EXCHG_0002_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = PropertyReadFile
prop_file_name = 'EXCHG_0002_LOGPCOMBINED.inp'
nprop = 1
 read_type = element
[../]
[./damage_read_EXCHG_0003_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = PropertyReadFile
prop_file_name = 'EXCHG_0003_LOGPCOMBINED.inp'
nprop = 1
 read_type = element
[../]
[./damage_read_EXCHG_0004_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = PropertyReadFile
prop_file_name = 'EXCHG_0004_LOGPCOMBINED.inp'
nprop = 1
 read_type = element
[../]

[Controls]
[controls_EXCHG_0001_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = ConditionalFunctionEnableControl
enable_objects = 'Materials::damage_EXCHG_0001_LOGPCOMBINED UserObjects::damage_read_EXCHG_0001_LOGPCOMBINED BCs::drain_DRAINSRFUG_Y2017_M08'
conditional_function = 'if(t>= 0 & t< 0.08,1,0)'
execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
[]
[controls_EXCHG_0002_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = ConditionalFunctionEnableControl
enable_objects = 'Materials::damage_EXCHG_0002_LOGPCOMBINED UserObjects::damage_read_EXCHG_0002_LOGPCOMBINED BCs::drain_DRAINSRFUG_Y2017_M09'
conditional_function = 'if(t>= 0.08 & t< 0.17,1,0)'
execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
[]
[controls_EXCHG_0003_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = ConditionalFunctionEnableControl
enable_objects = 'Materials::damage_EXCHG_0003_LOGPCOMBINED UserObjects::damage_read_EXCHG_0003_LOGPCOMBINED BCs::drain_DRAINSRFUG_Y2017_M10'
conditional_function = 'if(t>= 0.17 & t< 0.25,1,0)'
execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
[]
[controls_EXCHG_0004_LOGPCOMBINED]
type = ConditionalFunctionEnableControl
enable_objects = 'Materials::damage_EXCHG_0004_LOGPCOMBINED UserObjects::damage_read_EXCHG_0004_LOGPCOMBINED BCs::drain_DRAINSRFUG_Y2017_M11'
conditional_function = 'if(t>= 0.25 & t< 0.33,1,0)'
execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
[]

Hello
I would write a derived class of PropertyReadFile that would not read on initialSetup but read on timestepSetup instead, with a boolean to only read once.
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud,
How do I actually implement this into MOOSE object? for example the PropertyReadFile 
I looked into its source file, I don't see anything related to the initialSetup at all
where do i place virtual void timestepSetup(); into the source file? there is no example at all :(
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/interfaces/SetupInterface.html
Kind regards,
Traiwit

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/moose/classSetupInterface.html#aa801b019cc7b06131dcacb126f616270
they are virtual, and unimplemented for that object.
So you can implement them and then they will run.
Reading might not have been on initialSetup, it s been a while since I was in that code

So the simplest way would be make a copy of PropertyReadFile and put it into virtual void timestepSetup(); ?
coz even though I tried exceute_on = 'none' it still read the file during the initial setup
well right now it (readData) is in the constructor so you can't stop that by not executing

move (and possibly adapt) the readData call from the constructor to a new timestepStep() routine seems like a workable solution.
You ll want to make it your own object (eg make a copy and change the name) in your own app though

Hi @GiudGiud I managed to create a copy of readfile object, i'm still confused on where to i put it into timestepStep()
looking at SetupInterface.C (or .h) they look empty to me, still not exactly sure what to do.
Regards,
Traiwit

Hi @GiudGiud
a quick question, so do the very first file will always be read at the setup stage? or at timestep_begin?
So i'm making the version where it read file according to the vector of time (just in case the simulation does not converge, so it wont mess up the sequence of files), but I find that the very first file doesn't follow/print the same stuff as later time_steps
  [damage_read]
    type = PropertyReadFileTimeBased
    prop_file_name = 'damage_01.csv damage_01.csv damage_02.csv damage_03.csv damage_04.csv damage_05.csv'
    time_per_file = ' 0 1  2  3  4  5'  **for some reason I need to specify time/file at timestep = 0, so the sequence is correct
    nprop = 1
    read_type = element
    execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
  []

Below is the console, please dont mind a lot of printing, i will clean those up later, but yeh at timestep = 1, it doesn't even say it read damage_01.csv, but it already read (i check the results and they are fine).
  Time Step 0, time = 0

Time Step 1, time = 1, dt = 1

here is the .C (this version is probs good for the main MOOSE as well :) )
#include "PropertyReadFileTimeBased.h"


registerMooseObject("moose_behApp", PropertyReadFileTimeBased);


InputParameters
PropertyReadFileTimeBased::validParams()
{
  InputParameters params = PropertyReadFile::validParams();
  params.addParam<std::vector<Real>>("time_per_file", "Vector of timesteps at which to switch property files");


  return params;
}

PropertyReadFileTimeBased::PropertyReadFileTimeBased(const InputParameters & parameters)
  : PropertyReadFile(parameters),
  _time_per_file(getParam<std::vector<Real>>("time_per_file")),
  _current_time(0), // Initialize _current_time
  _initialize_called_once(declareRestartableData<bool>("initialize_called", false))
{

}


void PropertyReadFileTimeBased::initialize()
{

  _console << "test test" << std::endl;

  _console << " time_size: " << _time_per_file.size() << std::endl;
  _console << " file_size: " << _prop_file_names.size() << std::endl;
  
    // if (!_initialize_called_once)
    // {
    //     _initialize_called_once = true;
    //     return;
    // }

    // Update _current_time to the current simulation time
    _current_time = _fe_problem.time();
    // Print the contents of _time_per_file for debugging
    _console << "Contents of _time_per_file: ";
    for (size_t i = 0; i < _time_per_file.size(); ++i) {
        _console << _time_per_file[i] << " ";
    }
    _console << std::endl;


    // _console << "Before loop - Current time: " << _current_time << ", Current file index: " << _current_file_index << std::endl;

    _console << "At Time Step: " << _current_time << std::endl;
    _console << "Current file index before loop: " << _current_file_index << std::endl; 
    for (size_t i = 0; i < _time_per_file.size(); ++i)
    {
        // If the current time is equal to or has just surpassed a specified time point
        // and we haven't switched to this file yet
        // _console << "Condition checks for i = " << i << ": Time check: " << (_current_time >= _time_per_file[i]) << ", Index check: " << (_current_file_index < i) << std::endl;
        _console << "Checking against time point: " << _time_per_file[i] << " for file index " << i << std::endl;
        _console << "Condition checks for i = " << i << ": Time check: " << (_current_time >= _time_per_file[i]) << ", Index check: " << (_current_file_index < i) << std::endl;
        if (_current_time >= _time_per_file[i] && _current_file_index < i)
        {
            _console << "Entering condition with i = " << i << std::endl;
            // Update the current file index to this new index
            _current_file_index = i;
            
            _console << "_current_file_index " << _current_file_index << std::endl;

            // Ensure the new file index is within the bounds of the files list
            if (_current_file_index < _prop_file_names.size())
            {
                // Print the name of the file that is about to be read
                _console << "Reading property file: " << _prop_file_names[_current_file_index] << std::endl;

                // Set the new file name for the reader and read the data
                _reader.setFileName(_prop_file_names[_current_file_index]);
                readData();

                _current_file_index = _current_file_index - 1;
                
            }
            else
            {
                _console << "Specified time exceeds available files. No new file will be read." << std::endl;
            }

            // Since we've found the file to switch to, break out of the loop
            break;
        }
    }
}

Thank you,
Trai

It s read on setup.
So yes you may be seeing oddities there. You could add a Boolean parameter to choose between doing the first reading on setup and on first execution

You could add a Boolean parameter to choose between doing the first reading on setup and on first execution

Hi @GiudGiud
I spent an hr looking for this, how do I do this? and what are the options available?
couldn't find the guide anywhere.
Thank you!
Traiwit
I meant coding that boolean. It hasn't been added yet

Hi @GiudGiud
sorry for asking again, I thought I could do it but I couldn't
How to make it execute at the timestep_begin since the first file? I still notice that the first file is still required during the initial setup.
Thank you
Traiwit
No worries. I ll put up a PR to moose for this.
Thank you @GiudGiud !

Hi @GiudGiud
Thank you for quickly added that option to PropertyReadFile
However, I got an error then I set load_first_file_on_construction = false
when load_first_file_on_construction = true there is no problem the script read file as expected
*** ERROR ***
The supplied index 1 is out-of-range for the available data in file '/home/moose/Hydro_Krw_test/damage_01.csv' which contains 0 items.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 1


*** ERROR ***
The supplied index 9 is out-of-range for the available data in file '/home/moose/Hydro_Krw_test/damage_01.csv' which contains 0 items.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 2


*** ERROR ***
The supplied index 0 is out-of-range for the available data in file '/home/moose/Hydro_Krw_test/damage_01.csv' which contains 0 items.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 3


*** ERROR ***
The supplied index 2 is out-of-range for the available data in file '/home/moose/Hydro_Krw_test/damage_01.csv' which contains 0 items.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0

you need to make sure to use the object after the file has been read.
So execute the user object as early as possible to read the file.
force_preaux = true and maybe a execute_on = TIMESTEP_BEGIN at least

yep I used both, still gives the same error when load_first_file_on_construction = false
  [damage_read]
    type = PropertyReadFile
    prop_file_name = 'damage_01.csv damage_02.csv damage_03.csv damage_04.csv damage_05.csv'
    nprop = 1
    read_type = element
    execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
    load_first_file_on_construction = false
    force_preaux = true
  []

but it's okay, I can work around this
Thank you!
Traiwit

node.title: How to set the number of parallel CPUs for older versions of MOOSE
node.bodyText: I used an older version of MOOSE on the cluster for sensitivity analysis (which had invalid min/max_procs_per-app values), and used a total of 80 CPUs to calculate 256 sample data. I want to calculate 2 samples at a time, with 40 CPUs per sample. Or calculate one sample at a time, one CPU per sample. How do I operate it?
Please update your moose version, the control over processor per app was introduced in 2021. If you don't have access to that, I am afraid we cannot help you.

node.title: Questions about natural boundary condition and non-zero normal stress in INSAD
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am trying to extend the INSAD module to include natural boundary conditions for the mass equation and non-zero normal stress for the momentum equation. See https://github.com/doquang/slip_flow. It seems to work for the low Re case (rho=400), but doesn't converge for the rho=1000 case. I'm wondering,

Is the way I'm doing it correct?
If correct, is there any way to improve convergence?
For the working cases (rho=400). I still see some normal flow through the surface 100. Is that acceptable?

Thanks!

I don't know what surface 100 is, but these results look reasonable to me with an initial eye test. If you submit a pull request to MOOSE I will give it a detailed look-over.
I am not surprised that you are having problems converging with a Reynolds number of 1000. You probably need more diffusion which is typically achieved by adding a turbulence model
@lindsayad - Please see the PR ##26827
@lindsayad - I have to create a new PR #26833

node.title: Anyone running moose applications through visual studio code?
node.bodyText: I saw a thread where someone had mentioned about using files like launch.json, task.json but it's  not working for me.
@loganharbour @dschwen  do you know someone who uses this
I'm new to moose. I wanted to understand how to use a debugger so that I can understand the workflow for developing application. I have found Ubuntu's gdb debugger for now which I'm using.

node.title: Installation Issue: MOOSE Installation Fails on Linux Ubuntu 22.04.3 as libgcc-ng >=12 does not exist
node.bodyText:
I am a Linux user and I am trying to install MOOSE. I have closely followed the installation instructions on the MOOSE website (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/conda.html), but I get the following error message when I execute the command  conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.01.23 in my terminal:
Channels:
 - https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
 - defaults
Platform: linux-64
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed

LibMambaUnsatisfiableError: Encountered problems while solving:
  - nothing provides libgcc-ng >=12 needed by moose-wasp-2023.11.29-build_0

Could not solve for environment specs
The following package could not be installed
└─ moose-dev 2024.01.23**  is not installable because it requires
   └─ moose-wasp 2023.11.29.* , which requires
      └─ libgcc-ng >=12 , which does not exist (perhaps a missing channel). 

It seems the issue is that libgcc-ng >=12 does not seem to exist or is not detectable? Can anyone tell me how I can resolve this issue, as I desperately need to install MOOSE asap. Thanks in advance!

It might be that you are using an installation of Conda that does not include the conda-forge channel? Like Anaconda's main channel or something.
You might need to add conda-forge and then our channel:
conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda config --set channel_priority strict
conda config --add channels https://conda.software.inl.gov/public

channel_priority strict will be necessary in your case I think

Ref: https://conda-forge.org/docs/user/tipsandtricks/#why-does-that-happen


--add channel https://conda.software.inl.gov/public should be added again, to be at the top priority.

Thanks very much. Adding conda-forge using conda config --add channels conda-forge worked. I didn't execute the other two commands you suggested as I tried this before your reply. But this still produced a successful installation. Thanks for your response!

node.title: Implementation of spectral boundary intergal and possible link to BOOST c++ library
node.bodyText: Hi all, I would like to implement spectral boundary integral (see Appendix B in the reference article: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/nag.2865), which involves complex values, time integration, inverse laplace transform, etc, just as a startup question, does MOOSE currently have sufficient functionality to implement it? I know the BOOST c++ library has special functions that could be suitable here, but I wonder how should I include the library within MOOSE? Thanks in advance for any suggestions!

We do not currently support using complex numbers in our MOOSE systems. @cticenhour has looked into that but I always forget what the status of it is. libMesh certainly supports configuring with complex numbers but we just haven't propagated that support into MOOSE. If you were writing custom user objects or something then you could certainly do whatever you want with <complex>.
The easiest way to bring in boost into MOOSE is to configure libmesh pointing at a boost installation with the configure argument --with-boost[=ARG] where you can supply an installation directory for boost if it's in a non-standard location

It has been so long now since I was able to work on that that I am going to have to think hard on it... As you implied, getting PETSc and libMesh built wasn't a problem, but I think propagating the fact that Number is how a complex quality through all of our typedefs and templated methods was just a huge lift. My memory tells me that I started that conversion process, and I think I got hung up on the Residual and Jacobian methods and how to properly populate the matrices. I'm still interested in doing the work, but I might need to apply for some funding to have time to do it. It'll become more important to have that capability in future fusion projects I think.

To echo something @lindsayad said that is more useful to @chunhuizhao478 for the moment - I used <complex> in many objects in the electromagnetics module to do complex calculations under the hood, and then had the object output the portion of the calculation I needed (imaginary or real) to the variable representing that portion of the calculation.
Thanks @cticenhour and @lindsayad for your help! I wonder if @cticenhour could direct me some examples you have? Thanks again!

VectorEMRobinBC (source code link for current version) is one example object where we have to do this. More usage and object examples can be found through the https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/electromagnetics page.
